trans-unit.source: Represents the kind of event that has occurred on a view of a control at design time.
This class cannot be inherited.

A ViewEvent object is provided to the designer component by the design host, for example [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], when raising an event caused by certain user actions on the design-time view of a control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent?displayProperty=fullName> event is handled by a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventHandler> delegate method, which takes a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object as a parameter.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> class is a ViewEvent object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventHandler> delegate method compares the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventType%2A> property to the static ViewEvent fields to determine which type of action raised the event.
For example, an event is raised under the following circumstances: - You click a region on the design surface.
- The designer draws a control on the design surface.
- You enter or exit template editing mode for a control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class supplies a default delegate to handle the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent?displayProperty=fullName> event.

Custom control designers override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnClick%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnPaint%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.OnTemplateModeChanged%2A> methods to process those events for the control on the design surface.

The designer host initializes a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object for the type of action on the design surface, and then passes the object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventHandler> delegate.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object indicates which type of action: - A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.Click> event.
- A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.Paint> event.
- A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.TemplateModeChanged> event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventArgs%2A> property supplies the event arguments that are specific to the type of action.
Indicates that a view event was raised for a click on a designer region.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventHandler> delegate method compares the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventType%2A> property to the static <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent> fields to determine which type of action raised the event.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent> object is equal to Click to indicate that you clicked a region on the design surface.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class supplies a default <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventHandler> delegate.
If the event type is Click, the delegate calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnClick%2A> method.

Classes deriving from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnClick%2A> method to handle click events on a region at design time.
The event arguments indicate which designer region was clicked, if any.
To be added.
Indicates that a view event was raised for drawing a control on the design surface.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventHandler> delegate method compares the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventType%2A> property to the static <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent> fields to determine which type of action raised the event.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent> object is equal to Paint to indicate a paint event on the control on the design surface.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class supplies a default <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventHandler> delegate.
If the event type is Paint, the delegate calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnPaint%2A> method.

Classes deriving from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnPaint%2A> method to handle click events on a region at design time.
To be added.
Indicates that a view event was raised for changing the template mode of a control designer.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventHandler> delegate method compares the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventType%2A> property to the static <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent> fields to determine which type of action raised the event.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent> object is equal to TemplateModeChanged to indicate that the template editing mode changed for a control on the design surface.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class supplies a default <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventHandler> delegate.
If the event type is TemplateModeChanged, the delegate sets the value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.InTemplateMode%2A> property.

Custom designers that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner> class can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.OnTemplateModeChanged%2A> method to perform additional processing when the template editing mode changes for a control on the design surface.
To be added.
